column5: Your hired!  I saw Bob Izumi eating perch from T.O. water. Apparently it's O.K. when they are a small/young fish.  I guess what I'm saying is that if we get out in the spring again our new wager will be on who gets to clean and cook our shore lunch!

Well, I've been on this board for over a year now, and bly and I pretty much live release everything we catch. Well, at the Fishing for Tyler event yesterday, we brought home a bunch of perch with the idea of trying our first fish fry.....

Ok...so we had a sink full of Perch....had to figure out how to clean them all...

A quick search on the internet brings up a bunch of videos and sites that show you how to clean fish. So, I chose one of them and decided to try to clean them. I'm sure I left some meat on them, but I managed to get thru this exercise in about 45 minutes. I had my helper handing me the fish one at a time, while I sliced them up.....



Then, using TJs secret batter recipe, we fried them up...and the kitchen was filled with sweet smells!



And here's the final result....and it turned out great!!!
That's great Cliff!!!  Your daughter looks adorable handing you those fish with the glove on!  Looks like the fish came out perfectly for you  ... I wonder what Muskie tastes like fried eh?

I am having a hard time believing that someone with 4199 posts on a fishing forum has never cleaned a fish before! Thereâ€™s hope for me yet. I cleaned my first fish last summer (at the tender age of 45). It is still frozen in the freezer. It looks like it was a nice father daughter bonding moment, and thanks for the great video.
Nice job Cliff, the end result looks great.
yum...
WOW.....I bet you'll be keeping a few more perch from now on eh.....LOL.  Looks good for the first time......the filleting get easier the more you do it!!  Sinker
A feast fit for a king and his family.    Very nice.

There is always hope lol  As we were fishing yesterday Cliff was tellimg to me that I had work to do when I got home.....no worries, received a new fillet nice for Christmas and was looking forward to using it.....surprise....Cliff decided to give it a try!  He did a great job!
Looks good  Maureen
Radnine...you read my mind..lol  Cheers Craig

What??? LOL.  It's true...most of my fish are caught in Lake Ontario, and I still remember the days in the 70's when the warnings were around about not eating anything from the lake.  I just started fishing a year and a half ago (after a 20 year break) and today was the first time I ever tried to clean and cook fish.  These perch were out of Simcoe so I thought, why not??
He probably just got tired of waiting for you to get off the phone Bly !
How many fish did you catch yesterday Wayne??
MY Simcoe Limit !
mmm perch!
Well done Cliff.
Me thinks catch and release percentage is going to change.  Walleye is too yummy to throw back of course we don't see small walleye pics from you and Bly.
Mmmm, now I'm hungry.  Looks like you did a pretty great job cleaning, got some nice sized filets.  So, tell me, how did you get TJ's secret recipe.  Obviously not a secret anymore then eh  Joey
Very nice work Cliff! looks great!

Cliff,  Way to go on the fish fry.  Nothing like the first time, don't worry its never as much fun again.  My wife and I had our first 2 years ago, now we are hooked on fresh pearch and the occasional walleye.
He revealed it to Bly in a drunken state at Lakair last year...sworn to secrecy of course....  The reciepe that is...get yer mind out of the gutter!!

Cliff... nice job bud....  Your one of the lucky few I share that recipe with....  lol.. but  if i recall I had had a few and bly was hittin' on me....  hard to not give it up!!!  And Joey... we can make a deal... as long as Pauls not around....
mmmm looks good. makin me hungry!
lol @ the gloves your daughter is wearing, cute!  mmmmmm perch
